column2: FLORIDA DMV PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
Question Text
1. Who is required to wear a bicycle helmet in Florida?
column4: Bicyclists owning a professional riding license.

column2: 2. At 50 MPH, on dry pavement with good brakes, the average braking distance is about:
3. Parking is NOT allowed:
4. Which of the following is a possible sign of aggressive driving?
column8: Throwing objects from a moving vehicle.

column2: 5. Which of the following is true about a double solid white line?
column4: It marks the edge of the pavement on most roads.
column6: It prohibit vehicles moving in either direction from crossing the line.
column8: It separates two lanes of traffic going in the same direction.

column2: 6. Which of the following is NOT safe when passing:
column6: Getting close to the vehicle you want to pass.
column8: On a two-lane road, tapping your horn to let the other driver know you are passing.

column2: 7. If you are in a crash while driving, you must:
column4: attain vehicle, witness and driver information.

column2: 8. Green traffic signs:
column6: are used to identify parking spaces for disabled drivers.
column10: warn drivers of unexpected roadway conditions.

column2: 9. Unlike passenger cars, trucks have blind spots:
10. Before making a left or right turn, you should signal for at least:
11. This sign indicates:
12. What does a flashing red light mean?
column8: The same thing as a stop sign.
column10: Drivers may move forward with caution.

column2: 13. Which of the following is true about roundabouts?
column8: Roundabouts are also called 'open intersections' or 'uncontrolled intersections'.
column10: They give drivers less time to judge.

column2: 14. When an animal suddenly runs in front of your vehicle, you should:
column6: concentrate on regaining control of the vehicle before, during, and after the collision with the animal.
column10: swerve into oncoming traffic to avoid the collision.

column2: 15. It is against the law to:
column8: use directional signals when changing lane.
column10: use your directional signals to tell drivers behind you that they can pass.

column2: 16. If a passenger who is 18 years of age or older fails to wear a seat belt when required by law:
column4: he/she is violating the Seat Belt Law.
column6: a seat belt violation will be charged to the passenger.
column8: a seat belt violation will be charged to the driver.
column10: there is no violation. Only passengers who are under 18 must wear safety belts.

column2: 17. Which of the following is NOT correct? Drivers entering a road from a driveway should:
column4: yield to bicyclists and pedestrians on the sidewalk or bike lanes.
column6: use their emergency lights to indicate their intention to turn.
column8: yield to vehicles already on the main road.

column2: 18. Which of the following is a possible sign of road rage?
column6: Getting out of the left lane for other fast moving vehicles.
column10: Avoiding eye contact with other drivers.

column2: 19. Which of the following is NOT true about roundabouts:
column4: Drivers entering the roundabout have the right-of-way.
column6: They give drivers more time to judge.
column8: Trucks are not allowed to enter roundabouts.

column2: 20. Directions given by traffic officers ___________ signs, signals or pavement markings.
21. A stopped school bus is picking up children on a two way street. All drivers moving ____________________ must stop.
column8: in the same direction as the bus
column10: in the opposite direction of the bus

column2: 22. What should drivers do in case of a tire blowout?
23. If a law enforcement officer is directing traffic where there are signal lights, drivers should:
column6: obey the officer - not the signals.
column10: obey the signals - not the officer.

column2: 24. When driving in fog at night, you should use:
25. What are flashing arrow panels used for?
column4: To tell drivers that they should not turn in the direction shown by the panel.
column6: To give advance warning and directional information to drivers.
column8: They are regulatory signs used to indicate that there will be fewer lanes ahead.

column2: 26. Which lane is the acceleration lane?
27. This sign means:
column6: The road will curve to the right, then to the left.
column8: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column10: Road slippery when wet. Drive slowly.

column2: 28. If moving to the curb to stop your vehicle, you should:
column4: check mirrors for traffic to the rear and signal your intention.
column8: stop suddenly and move to within 12 inches of the curb.
column10: stop at the next gas station.

column2: 29. This sign means:
column6: Left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column10: The road will curve to the right.

column2: 30. The octagonal shape is used:
column4: to warn drivers of existing or possible hazards on roadways.
column10: for stop signs and railroad advance warning signs.

column2: 31. When driving in low visibility, drivers should:
column6: slow down before entering a patch of fog.

column2: 32. With conventional brakes, the correct way to stop in an emergency situation where traction is lost and the car slides is:
33. The arrow in the center lane indicates that:
column4: vehicles must use the lane to make a U-turn.
column6: vehicles may pass only when it is safe to do so.
column8: vehicles in the center lane can travel in both directions.
column10: traffic in this lane can be reversed to help handle rush-hour traffic.

column2: 34. The seat belt law exempts the following from the seat belt requirements:
column4: Trucks of a net weight of more than 26,000 pounds.

column2: 35. Golf carts may be operated only on state roads that have a posted speed limit of __ MPH or less.
36. What should drivers do when the red lights begin to flash?
37. Every car must have a white light that makes the license plate visible from how many feet away?
38. A car is parked 10 feet from a fire hydrant. Is it legally parked?
column4: Yes, but only if the fire hydrant is within 20 feet of an intersection.
column6: No. Parking is not allowed within 15 feet of a fire hydrant.
column8: No. Parking is never allowed when there is a fire hydrant.
column10: Yes, parking is allowed within 10 feet from a fire hydrant.

column2: 39. When parking downhill, drivers should:
column6: turn the wheels so that if their car starts to move, it will roll away from the curb.

column2: 40. A DUI conviction will remain on your driving record for:
41. A four-way stop sign means:
column4: if two vehicles reach the intersection at the same time, the driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.
column6: there are four stop signs at this intersection.
column8: traffic from all four directions must stop.

column2: 42. Vehicles with Specialty License Plates that display the International Symbol of Access:
column4: may access any international parking area.
column8: may legally park in spaces reserved for people with disabilities.
column10: are reserved for foreign people with disabilities.

column2: 43. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: there is a reduction of lanes ahead.
column6: there is a right turn ahead.
column10: they must stay on the right side of the divider

column2: 44. Which of the following is NOT correct? Before you start your engine you should:
column6: adjust the seat so you can reach all controls.
column8: make sure your car is in first gear.

column2: 45. What does this sign indicate?
column6: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column8: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.
column10: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.

column2: 46. To steer the vehicle away from hazards while braking, drivers with ABS should:
column6: keep firm and constant pressure on the brake pedal while stopping.
column10: pump the brakes and turn the steering wheel hard in one direction.

column2: 47. This sign indicates:
column6: The road may be slippery when wet. Drive slowly.
column8: Double curve ahead. Slow your speed.

column2: 48. Seat belts on buses are exempt on buses purchased new prior to:
49. The average reaction distance at 60 MPH is:
50. When passing another vehicle, you should:
column4: give your signal before you move into the left lane.
column6: stay on the left side of the road until you come within 50 feet of any vehicle coming from the opposite direction.
column8: return to the right side of the road before you can see the tires of the vehicle you passed in your rearview mirror.
